item.title: Thoughts On Reading Crafting Interpreters
item.description: Since starting my career, I’ve worked with high-level languages like Go, Ruby, and Python, valuing their abstraction of low-level complexities and their productivity boost. But I soon craved a deeper challenge, which led me to systems programming and low-level development. At the end of summer, I set a goal: to dive into Crafting Interpreters by Robert Nystrom. Back in university, I built an AST-based interpreter while studying compilers—functional but slow and far from production-ready.
